intro: Scabiosa gramuntia var. pinnatifida, commonly known as the slender scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided, pinnatifid (feather-like) leaves. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, often found in dry grasslands and rocky habitats. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to wildflower gardens.
